scope_of_work.problem:
Essential Remedial works are required to the NHBR Kyndryl Generators,
which supports Kyndryl internal and external clients.This project is for the full top-end overhaul and radiator replacement on HV Generator 4 plus weather-proofing of the enclosures for HV Generators 1, 2 and 4.
scope_of_work.scope:
[2:06 PM] Jowett, Paul @ Sale
Scope of WorksProblem Statement:Essential Remedial works are required to the NHBR Kyndryl Generators,
which supports Kyndryl internal and external clients.This project is for the full top-end overhaul and radiator replacement on HV Generator 4 plus weather-proofing of the enclosures for HV Generators 1, 2 and 4.Scope of Works: The following items are to be delivered as a minimum to satisfy the aims of this project:
All works to be completed in accordance with  Kyndryl Change Control approvals and are subject to IBM / Kyndryl Change Freeze windows.
 CBRE BP 19 applies for the Project Management delivery.
All work is to be performed as per CBRE reviewed and approved contractor Method Statements.
Relevant CBRE Field Switching Procedures to be approved prior to execution of the works.
Generators 1, 2 & 4 enclosure weather-proofing solution to be warranted for a minimum of 5 years.
Generators 1, 2 & 4 enclosure weather-proofing solution to include up to 100mm (or maximum allowable) of all penetration/service points through the enclosure roofs.
Generators 1, 2 & 4 enclosure weather-proofing solution to be able to withstand the temperatures experienced at the enclosure roofs while the engine is running eg: Generator exhaust heat. Will be subject to heat tests and check
Generator 4
Remove the existing roof mounted radiator cooling system. Crane hire and scaffolding to be included.
Strip and remove the major Generator components (including cylinder heads) for overhaul. NOTE: The enclosure roof may require removal to enable the head and top-end removal works to be completed. If any concerns reference the structural integrity of the enclosure
 are identified due to the level of corrosion, enclosure to be replaced.
Replacement Generator enclosure (if required) to provide the following:
· Existing SWA electrical supply to the enclosure to be tested before re-use
· fuel leak detection and fuel leak containment if disconnected for the works, retest if fitted
· any changes required to feed new equipment on the Roof Radiator will be rested from local auxiliary distribution boards (the existing is 1x 8-way 125A TP&N distribution panel to support the power equipment associated with the Generator (radiator fans etc)
 and 1x 6-way 63A SP&N for the small power equipment serving the Generator enclosure (local lighting and enclosure heating, controls, auxiliary supplies, starter batteries & battery charger etc).
· If any fire links or Fire systems are disconnected then they shall be reinstated on completion of each day - and validate from the Generator to the existing Fire Alarm control panel interface to integrate with the existing Tyco Fire Alarm system (sited in
 the Data Centre), also validate the existing enclosure detection, fuel shut-off valve, air induction flaps etc as part of the Load test and commissioing
Complete major top-end overhaul (includes some of the work of a major overhaul but excludes sump removal, crankshaft removal and replacement of main bearing shells). NOTE: This is due to the low engine running hours.
Replace the existing roof mounted radiator cooling system and commission. Crane hire and scaffolding to be included.
Only genuine OEM spare parts to be used.
Re-use (or replace as necessary) all existing power & control cabling.
Ensure that these are retested on completion to the Current BS 7671 wiring regulations
Provide a resistive load bank to be provided for site testing on completion.
Warranty period of 12 months from commissioning date to be provided.
Also assess what options are avaolbel for a 5 year warranty cover
All signage and maintenance documentation to be updated to reflect the ‘new’ assets.
The delivery, implementation and testing of a complete solution, to satisfy the aims of the project, is required.
· Deliver solution as per the Scope
· Provide schedule for the works from release of funding
· Assess if this requires CDM or planning requirements
· Update all electrical, mechanical schematics and maintenance documentation.
· Any updated drawings to be provided in AutoCad and pdf format
· Update the CMMS system (MAXIMO) and establish preventative maintenance schedule for recertified installation
· Provide recommissioning report post works, based on the previously agreed schedule and recommissioning plan. In line with the Best practices.
scope_of_work.justification:
Essentail Remedial works are required to the NHBR Kyndryl Generators,
which supports Kyndryl internal and external clients.
· IBM North Harbour is supported by 4x 2500kVA 11kV Generators. The N condition is currently served by 2x Generators. The Generators supporting the Data Centre Critical Infrastructure were manufactured circa 1995/96 and have been in service at North Harbour
 from 1996/97 onwards.
· All Generators have been identified with ongoing issues with their enclosures (evidence of water ingress). Additionally, Generators 3 & 4 have been identified as having engine cooling system (including radiator) issues.
· HV Generator 3 is scheduled for full replacement via Capex Funding in 2022.
· This requirement is intended to address all essential remedial works required on Generators 1, 2 & 4.
· Generators 1 and 2 enclosures are to be weather-proofed including the replacement of all rainwater guttering.
· Generator 4 is to have its radiator and associated cooling system replaced plus subject a full top-end overhaul.
· Generator 4 enclosure will be weather-proofed on completion including the replacement of all rainwater guttering.
· HV Generator sets 1, 2 & 3 will remain in service during Generator 4’s full top-end overhaul and radiator replacement.Effect of Non Approval
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Continued increased risk to the DC IT load with potential for loss to both Kyndryl and their customers

associated_items: the assositated items with their boolean values are mentioned: As Builts (Yes), EANS/CMMS Update (Yes), O&M Manuals (Yes), Job Punch List (Yes), Health & Safety Form (EPIC Form) (Yes), Single Source Approval (Yes), Close-Out Checklist (Yes)
approvals: Total Labour Cost: 36110.308421053, Total Supply Chain Cost: 1193027.6406, Total Other Cost: 0. Approval - Status: Approved, Grand Total: 689652.3125
closeout_billing: No project closeout and billing information

status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Prof. Bella Adams Jr. (2):rejected by Prof. Bella Adams Jr. (3):offer submitted by Prof. Bella Adams Jr.

scope_of_work.notes:
1. CBRE quotation valid for a period of 90 days from revision date stated above
2. Does not include any contingency 
3. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value
4. CBRE plan to bill Kyndryl based on a percentage of completion basis in line with works completed
5. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by IBM through the eBVO process
6. Duration of the project is expected to take circa 30  weeks on site
7. If the single source approval identified below is shown as - Not applicable, it is because none of the trades exceeds the single sourcing limit 
8.Consequential hours based on the follwowing duration :
6 Week Programme for Overhaul 
7 Week Programme per set for roof works (3xSets)
4 Week Programme for Radiator Replacement
Load Bank Test 3 days 
CoE Team 2 x Men 10 Days ( 20 days total )
9. Factory Test and design validation included
10. N+ 1 will be maintained through existing site Generators 1,2and 3 ( at current load )
11. Note any remedial works identified during the above scope of work are separate from this project LSQ and therefore not included

scope_of_work.problem: The external safety bomb blast film has degraded and is flaking off on the front of the building making the facade unsightly also the present condition does not provide any safety protection
scope_of_work.scope:
Attend CBRE office for induction and sign relevant paperwork
Remove old film and fit new safety film to 19no windows
Sign off relevant paperwork
scope_of_work.justification:
The external safety bomb blast film has degraded and is flaking off.
Present condition does not provide any safety protection as the existing glass is single glazed plate glass
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Loss of protection for the glass facade so no longer bombproof

approvals: Total Labour Cost: 560.76631578947, Total Supply Chain Cost: 0, Total Other Cost: 0. Approval - Status: Approved, Grand Total: 712.04
